page.title: 11Education, Thurleigh
page.content: Thurleigh has it's own Lower School and Nursery. The Nursery has 45 pupils that attend on a part-time basis. They come from surrounding villages as well as Thurleigh. The nursery teacher has been there since 1979 and the unit was not opened until 1977. The Lower School has 23, 5-9 year olds and they all live in Thurleigh. The headmistress, lives in the village and has taught at the school since 1972. The other teacher started at the school in 1971. They are both now teaching the children of former pupils. In addition to the basic reading, writing and arithmetic, the children are taught artand craft,P.E. and drama and do project work. The girls are able to learn lacemaking if they wish to. The recorder is learnt and they have their own maypole. The nativity is performed at Christmas.
